data.title: Robben Island
data.text: Robben Island is an island in Table Bay 6 9 kilometres 4 3 mi west of the coast of Bloubergstrand north of Cape Town South Africa It takes its name from the Dutch word for seals robben hence the Dutch Afrikaans name Robbeneiland which translates to Seal s Island Robben Island is roughly oval in shape long north south and wide with an area of It is flat and only a few metres above sea level as a result of an ancient erosion event It was fortified and used as a prison from the late seventeenth century until 1996 after the end of apartheid
